intro: Phyllostegia rubritincta, commonly known as the red-stemmed strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red stems and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
